acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.09mg/L of Crustacea (glass shrimp)  (ECETOC TR91, 2003).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It is based on rat dermal LD50= 685mg/kg (RTECS, 2004).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat; ENDPOINT: LD50;VALUE:46mg/kg; REFERENCE SOURCE: RTECS (2004)

carcinogenicity.rationale: As inorganic mercury compounds, it was out of the Category. Since it is classified into IARC Group 3 (IARC, 58, 1993) and ACGIH A4 (ACGIH-TLV, 2004).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and it is a metallic compound, behavior in water and bioaccumulative potential are unknown.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: ERG (Guide151, 2004) corresponding to the UNRTDG No. (1646) has a statement that it is "nonflammable", and it was classified as out of Category.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: In ATSDR (1999), since it estimated that mercury and mercury compounds induced chromosomal abnormality to the animal somatic cell in an in vivo, they were set to Category 2.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Inorganic compounds containing no oxygen and halogen.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: ERG (Guide151, 2004) corresponding to the UNRTDG No.(1646) indicates "nonflammable", and it was defined as "out of Category".

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Since the effect on generating (California EPA, Proposition 65 List of Chemicals, 2005) and reproductive (ACGIH-TLV, 2004) was indicated as mercury and mercury compounds or inorganic mercuries, it was considered as Category 2.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Since ERG (Guide151, 2004) corresponding to the U.N. number (1646) peculiar to a substance has a "nonflammable" statement, it carried out the outside of Category.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Due to the description that it may irritate to the eye (STTIG, 4th, 2002;HSFS, 1993), it was classified into Category 2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: From description with the possibility which indicates skin irritation in humans (DFGOT, vol.15, 2001[as inorganic mercury compounds]; STTIG, 4th, 2002;HSFS, 1993), mild irritation was considered to be a certain thing, and it was set to Category 3.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Since metallic mercury and inorganic mercury compound (as Hg) were made into those with skin sensitization (MAK/BAT, 2005; DFGOT, vol.15, 2001), they were set to Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water (the water solubility is obtained)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Since the effect on the central nervous systems and the kidney of humans was described as inorganic mercury compounds in Priority 1 document (ACGIH-TLV, 2004;EHC, 118, 1991), it was classified into Category 1 (a central nervous systems, the kidney).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: The substance was classified as Category 1 (kidneys) because there is a report concerning humans in a Priority 1 document (DFGOT, vol.15, 2001) that the target organs of the inorganic mercury compound are kidneys.
